question.title: AbstractMethodError when using Java 8 default interface methods with minSdk below 24
question.body:
I'm encountering the same issue as described in the following question: AbstractMethodError when use Java 8 default interface methods and implementation However, since my reputation is below 50, I couldn't comment on it, so I'm opening a new question.

We're seeing the same error, but haven't found a solution yet. Here's what we know so far:

The crash occurs when:

Building the APK via Build > Generate Signed APK

The minSdkVersion is set below 24

We considered the possibility that, when targeting SDKs below Java 8, default methods might be compiled as abstract methods. To verify this, we reverse-engineered the generated APK and confirmed that the default method was correctly compiled as a default method:

.class public interface abstract Lmy/TestListener;
.method public abstract test(ZI)V

.class public final synthetic Lmy/TestListener$-CC;
.method public static $default$test(Lmy/TestListener;ZI)V

As far as we understand, there are two possible solutions:

Set minSdkVersion to 24 or higher

Explicitly override the default method in the class that implements TestListener

However, we're currently unable to apply either of these solutions due to project constraints.

Is there any other workaround or fix for this issue besides the two mentioned above?

Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

question_comments.body: The line .method public static $default$test(Lmy/TestListener;ZI)V tells that there is a static method named $default$test inside the class my.TestListener$-CC, not the interface. That method may be result of transforming code from using default methods in an interface to not using default methods, however, if that’s the case, it’s obviously incomplete. There’s clearly an abstract method in the interface, so the implementation class needs a non-abstract counterpart which may invoke that static method if that’s the intended strategy, but this non-abstract method is missing.
@ManabuNakamura Your solution worked!   It seems like the ProGuard settings are affecting the build in some way.   Thanks a lot! May happiness and good fortune come your way.

@Holger I see, so while we can confirm that .method public static $default$test(Lmy/TestListener;ZI)V is provided, we can't really tell how it's compiled. For my learning, I'd appreciate any hints on how to actually compile and inspect such generated methods.
@julaine  Thanks.   I'll make sure to consider your suggestions in the future.
If I set minifyEnabled to true then Test().test() passes. I don't know why.

“…and confirmed that the default method was correctly compiled as a default method” I don’t see a default method in that output, so I don’t understand how you conclude that the default method has been compiled correctly. Since you didn’t provide the original declaration, it’s not clear how the correct output should look like.

I think this is a fine question (you mention you have constraints the original question does not have, so your question is different). Two suggestions: post your two solutions as an answer on the other question to help others, and mention your constraints in this question up-front (many people here will see 'I have the same question' and just instantly downvote you) Good luck with the actual problem, I don't know a solution.
